missionProperties.missionInfo:
{-} An Imperial figure can activate the red terminal when instructed. When this happens, click "Retrieve schematic" on the terminal.
{-} The heroes need to find the codes to the airlock control. It can be retrieved from the blue terminal.
{-} A hero carrying the codes can interact with the red terminal to release the airlock.
{-} The mission will progress when the blue terminal is found ({V}) or the schematic is retrieved.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.
missionProperties.startingObjective: Find the terminal with the airlock codes. Keep the Imperials away from the red terminal.
missionProperties.repositionOverride: Be adjacent to the red terminal.

events.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

Imperial fighters and boarding craft came out of nowhere. Before you knew it, stormtroopers were flooding into the Falcon. Now you find yourselves split between defending the ship and fighting for the codes to get free. {-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted spaces, divided between the two as evenly as possible. {-} Deploy Han Solo (Scoundrel) to the red highlighted space. Heroes control him as an ally. {-} An Imperial figure can activate the red terminal when instructed. When this happens, click "Retrieve schematic" on the terminal. {-} The heroes need to find the codes to the airlock control. It can be retrieved from the blue terminal. {-} A hero carrying the codes can interact with the red terminal to release the airlock. {-} The mission will progress when the blue terminal is found ({V}) or the schematic is retrieved. {-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

Han sprints back to the controls as you punch in the codes to release the airlock. “Okay, hit it!” The Falcon breaks away from the boarding shuttle. Fighters swoop in, but none can score a decent hit before you zoom into hyperspace.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} Rebel players choose one hero to receive the “Quickdraw Holster” Reward card.
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

“I guess we're doing this the hard way,” Han says. Sliding back into the cockpit, he hits the accelerator. A metallic squeal ends in a deafening crash as the Millennium Falcon wrenches away from the Imperial ship. Trailing pieces of the aft section, the Falcon blasts into hyperspace.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

eventActions.shortText: Retrieve the access disk. Keep the Imperials away from the red terminal.

eventActions.theText:
{-} An Imperial figure can activate the red terminal when instructed. When this happens, click "Retrieve schematic" on the terminal.
{-} A healthy hero can interact with the blue terminal ({J} or {I}) to retrieve the airlock access disk.
{-} If the access disk is dropped, a healthy hero can retrieve it.
{-} A hero carrying the codes can interact with the red terminal to release the airlock.
{-} The mission will progress when the access disk is retrieved ({V}) or the schematic is retrieved.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

eventActions.shortText: Release the airlock. Keep the Imperials away from the red terminal.

eventActions.theText:
{-} An Imperial figure can activate the red terminal when instructed. When this happens, click "Retrieve schematic" on the terminal.
{-} The blue neutral mission token represents the access disk.
{-} If the access disk is dropped, a healthy hero can retrieve it.
{-} A hero carrying the codes can interact with the red terminal to release the airlock.
{-} The mission will progress when the schematic is retrieved.
{-} The Rebels win when the airlock is released.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

eventActions.shortText: Release the airlock. Stop the Imperials from uploading the schematic.

eventActions.theText:
{-} The blue neutral mission token represents the access disk.
{-} If the access disk is dropped, a healthy hero can retrieve it.
{-} The red neutral mission token represents the schematic.
{-} An Imperial figure carrying the schematic can interact with the blue terminal to upload the schematic when instructed.
{-} If the schematic is dropped, an Imperial figure can retrieve it.
{-} The Rebels win when the airlock is released.
{-} The Rebels lose when the schematic is uploaded or all heroes are wounded.

eventActions.shortText: Find the blue terminal. Stop the Imperials from uploading the schematic.

eventActions.theText:
{-} The red neutral mission token represents the schematic.
{-} An Imperial figure carrying the schematic can interact with the blue terminal to upload the schematic when instructed.
{-} If the schematic is dropped, an Imperial figure can retrieve it.
{-} The heroes need to find the codes to the airlock control. It can be retrieved from the blue terminal.
{-} A hero carrying the codes can interact with the red terminal to release the airlock.
{-} The mission will progress when the blue terminal is found ({V}).
{-} The Rebels lose when the schematic is uploaded or all heroes are wounded.

eventActions.shortText: Retrieve the access disk. Stop the Imperials from uploading the schematic.

eventActions.theText:
{-} The red neutral mission token represents the schematic.
{-} An Imperial figure carrying the schematic can interact with the blue terminal to upload the schematic when instructed.
{-} If the schematic is dropped, an Imperial figure can retrieve it.
{-} A healthy hero can interact with the blue terminal ({J} or {I}) to retrieve the airlock access disk.
{-} If the access disk is dropped, a healthy hero can retrieve it.
{-} A hero carrying the codes can interact with the red terminal to release the airlock.
{-} The mission will progress when the blue terminal is found ({V}).
{-} The Rebels lose when the schematic is uploaded or all heroes are wounded.

eventActions.repositionText: Block access to the red terminal.

eventActions.otherTarget: the hero carrying the access disk

events.eventText: The door slides open to reveal a small computer room with beeping terminals.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: The Falcon's systems control the airlock. {-} A hero carrying the airlock codes can interact with the red terminal to release the airlock.
The Falcon's systems control the airlock. {-} A hero carrying the airlock codes can interact with the red terminal to release the airlock.

The Falcon's systems control the airlock, but also contain the ship's schematic. {-} An Imperial figure can activate the red terminal when instructed. When this happens, click "Retrieve schematic" on the terminal. {-} A hero carrying the airlock codes can interact with the red terminal to release the airlock.

The Imperial systems contain the airlock access codes.

{-} A healthy hero can interact with the blue terminal ({J} or {I}) to retrieve the airlock access disk.
{-} An Imperial figure carrying the schematic can interact with the blue terminal to upload the schematic. When this happens, click "Upload schematic".

The Imperial systems contain the airlock access codes.

{-} An Imperial figure carrying the schematic can interact with the blue terminal to upload the schematic. When this happens, click "Upload schematic".
The Imperial systems contain the airlock access codes.

eventActions.mainText:
You start slicing into the Star Destroyer's systems.

{-} Test {J} or {I}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on the terminal, then discard all strain tokens on the terminal. Enter the number of successes below.

inputList.theText:
You make some progress, but the security system keeps you out for now. You need to keep trying.

{-} For each {B} result, place 1 strain token on the terminal.

events.eventText:
Sparks burst from the console as you slice into it and load the access codes onto a disk. Finished, you blast the console to slag before moving to return to the Falcon. Red lights flash and alarms ring as a door opens behind you. More troops rush into the corridors to
prevent your escape.

You begin to engage your would-be captors as Han’s sarcastic voice crackles in on your comlink:

“You know, I was worried this would all be a little boring! Maybe next time you could send a distress beacon to the nearest Star Destroyer! In fact, why not invite Jabba and his goons to the party while we're at it?”

Despite your efforts, the Imperials manage to hack into the Falcon's systems. They throw the data chip to an athletic officer who immediately starts rushing off. {-} Deploy a regular Imperial Officer. This is the Data Carrier.

eventActions.customText:
{A} Move 4 toward the blue terminal.
{A} Move 1 to interact with the blue terminal.
{A} Move 4 toward the blue terminal.
{A} Move 1 to interact with the blue terminal.

eventActions.tbText: {-} If the Data Carrier is defeated, set his figure aside instead. (He still counts as defeated for the purpose of triggering abilities.)

eventActions.mainText:
The Data Carrier activates.

Is his figure set aside?

events.eventText: Immediately end this activation without resolving any instructions.

eventActions.mainText: Is the Data Carrier set aside?

events.eventText: Place his figure on the schematic. He immediately retrieves the schematic.

The Imperials increase their efforts.

{-} The Imperial figure closest to the Data Carrier becomes <color="red">Focused</color>.

mapEntities.mainText: Deploy the heroes evenly divided between the two blue spaces.

When this happens, click "Retrieve schematic" on the terminal. {-} A hero carrying the airlock codes can interact with the red terminal to release the airlock.
